section.section: This section applies to administrative contests of withholdings from an employee's earnings made by an employer for the purpose of complying with this title.

Nothing in this section may be construed to limit an employee's right to judicially contest an underlying court order requiring the employee to provide health insurance coverage for the employee's child.
An employee may only contest a withholding under this section based on a mistake of fact.

text.section: An employee may contest a withholding by sending a written request for an investigation to the Administration within 15 days after receiving notice of the withholding from the employer.

If an employee requests an investigation, the Administration:
shall conduct an investigation within 15 days after the request; and
on completion of the investigation, shall notify the employee of the results of the investigation and the employee's right to appeal the decision of the Administration to the Office of Administrative Hearings.

section.section: An employee may appeal the Administration's decision to the Office of Administrative Hearings by filing a written request for a hearing with the Administration or the Office of Administrative Hearings.
The request for a hearing shall be made:
An appeal under this section shall be conducted in accordance with Title 10, Subtitle 2 of the State Government Article.

text.section: Enrollment of the employee's child may not be stayed or terminated until the employer receives written notice that the contest is resolved in the employee's favor.
